intro: Phyllanthus glabricapsulus, commonly known as the smooth-capsuled phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, capsule-like fruits. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
